turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Oughtonhead Common.
turn.2: Oughtonhead Common Oughtonhead Common is a 17.4 hectare Local Nature Reserve in the Westmill district of Hitchin, Hertfordshire.
turn.4: It is owned and managed by North Hertfordshire District Council.
turn.6: The River Oughton flows along the edge of the site, which has a wide variety of habitats.
turn.7: What else is at the common?
turn.8: It is grazed by English Longhorn cattle, and there is a football pitch.
turn.9: Is there anything else interesting at the common?
turn.10: The Friends of Oughtonhead Common assist with maintaining the site.
turn.11: Is there anything else notable about the common?
turn.12: It is part of the Chilterns Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.
